Comment: The law was passed in 2005, 20 years ago.  I think everyone has had plenty of time to say what they wanted to say.    I’m not sure how I feel about it, but my family has passports, social security numbers, and I’m certain I have an fbi file from past clearance applications.
Author: j3remy2007

Comment: I’m confused. I’ve had a REAL ID driver’s license for years now. It started in my home state over a decade ago. I’ve had that gold star on my license since. Never thought anything of it.  Heck I have TSA PreCheck.   The gov has had all my info for decades.
Author: ITrCool

Comment: To get the star in my state you have to verify identity with a passport or certified birth certificate, a Social Security card, and 2 proofs of residency.  What's the big deal? We should have the same requirements to vote. Republicans in opposition to the Real ID program contradict themselves when they advocate for voter ID. I've had it for several years now, no big deal.
Author: social_dinosaur

Comment: If you have a cell phone then you have zero privacy anyway. Any illusion of privacy anymore is just that.
Author: ILikestoshare

Comment: Privacy? In 2025?   Little too late for that now.

Comment: Man everyone on here is all about big government, i see...

Comment: Yeah all it does in ensure all states are following federal standards on IDs that will be valid for flying.   I mean I'm all for it.   Honestly I'd rather go back to pre-9/11, but if we're here, let's be consistent about it.
